intro: Cyclosorus paraphysatus, commonly known as the slender water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically divided into four lobes, giving it a clover-like appearance. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are located on the underside of the leaves. Cyclosorus paraphysatus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
